description: In repeated iterations of function m->m/2 if m even, m->3m-1 if m odd, a(n) is minimum value achieved if starting from n.
comments: At least for n<10000, the only possible cycles reached include 1,2,1,..., 5,14,7,20,10,5,... and 17,50,25,74,37,110,55,164,82,41,122,61,182,91,272,136,68,34,17,... For n<5 only the first occurs, while for n<17 only the first two occur.
example: a(9)=5 since iteration starts: 9, 26, 13, 38, 19, 56, 28, 14, 7, 20, 10, 5, 14, 7, 20, 10, 5, ... and 5 is the smallest value
crossrefs: Cf. A001281. If n is in A039500 then a(n)=1, if n is in A039501 then a(n)=5, if n is in A039502 then a(n)=17. If n is negative then this becomes the 3x+1 problem and the minimum values become those which are most negative (i.e. maximum absolute values) as in A056959.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 18 2000
